original: Cederquist, Bror Einar, konstnär, Göteborg, f. 13/12/94 i Gbg av red. Aug. C. o. Charlotta Olsson. G. 43 m. Ella Louise Lindskog. — Stud. v. Gbgs h. latin, v. Valands målarsk. 14-17. Stud:res. i Tyskl., Belg., Schweiz, Frankr. o. Ital., elev v. div. målarsk. i Paris. Anst. s. kåsör o. tecknare i Göteborgs-Posten sed. 19. Sign.: Becq. Medl. av Gbgs Konstn :kl. fr. start., repr. i priv. saml. i Oslo, Sthlm, Gbg, Borås m. fl. städer. Skr.: Aga-tons äventyr, Göteborg runt på 8 dagar, Miljonären Agaton (23-25). Hob-bies: trolleri o. magik.
translated: Cederquist, Bror Einar, artist, Gothenburg, b. 13/12/94 in Gothenburg to editor Aug. C. and Charlotta Olsson. Married in 1943 to Ella Louise Lindskog. He studied at Gothenburg high school Latin department and at Valand's painting school from 1914-1917. He undertook study trips to Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, France, and Italy, where he was a student at various painting schools in Paris. He was employed as an editorial writer and illustrator at Gothenburgs-Posten newspaper since 1919, and used the signature Becq. He joined Gothenburg's Art Society from its start and his works are represented in private collections in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Borås, and other cities. He has written the books Agaton's Adventure, 8 Days Around Gothenburg, and Millionaire Agaton (1923-1925). His hobbies include magic and illusionism.
